sourceMeaningMnemonic: Both a <radical>leader</radical> and a <radical>king</radical> have a <kanji>duty</kanji> to protect their people. A good leader always protects his followers, and a good king always protects his subjects. This is their duty.
meaningInfo: Imagine yourself being protected by your king and leader. They don’t really like you, but it is their duty to protect you. See them fighting off evil doers and taking bullets for your sake.
readingMnemonic: You’re the village <reading>nin</reading>compoop (<ja>にん</ja>), but the king and the leader still have a <kanji>duty</kanji> to protect you. Even a nincompoop is important to the kings and leaders of the world.
readingInfo: You’re a nincompoop. Even though you’re so nincompoopy, your king and leader still have a duty to protect you. Feel happy and content, despite your nincompoopery.
